Property.preferredName: Not Malignant Neoplasm Not Therapy Associated Death
Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Joined in some kind of relationship.:The absence of life or state of being dead.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Joined in some kind of relationship.

treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.
